summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence from 2020-2021 between an Assistant U.S. Attorney and attorney Gary Stein regarding a subpoena for records from the Professional Children's School (PCS) related to Jeffrey Epstein. The emails discuss scheduling calls and seeking information about tuition payments, third-party payments, donations, or sponsored scholarships for Epstein from 1997 to 2000.

persons.name: Gary Stein
persons.role: Partner at Schulte Roth & Zabel LLP
persons.context: Attorney communicating with the U.S. Attorney's office regarding a subpoena for records from the Professional Children's School related to Jeffrey Epstein's financial transactions.

persons.name: Elizabeth Sullivan
persons.context: Prosecutor from the Southern District of New York corresponding with Gary Stein to follow up on a subpoena for records related to Jeffrey Epstein from the Professional Children's School.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The financial records being sought from the Professional Children's School are related to him, specifically regarding possible tuition payments, third-party payments, donations, or sponsored scholarships from 1997 to 2000.

connections.description: Prosecutor and private attorney communicating about a subpoena and records request related to the Jeffrey Epstein investigation.
Gary Stein, as an attorney, is being contacted regarding records pertaining to Jeffrey Epstein, suggesting a legal or professional connection to Epstein's affairs.

events.title: Period of financial transactions under investigation
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office is seeking records from the Professional Children's School for any third-party payments, donations, sponsored scholarships, or similar financial transactions related to Jeffrey Epstein during this period.

events.title: Follow-up on subpoena for school records
events.description: Email from Assistant U.S. Attorney Elizabeth Sullivan to Gary Stein asking if the Professional Children's School has records of third-party payments, donations, or sponsored scholarships for Jeffrey Epstein from 1997-2000, beyond the initial subpoena.

locations: Southern District of New York, New York, NY 10007
Schulte Roth & Zabel LLP, 919 Third Avenue, New York, NY 10022
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was investigating financial transactions between Jeffrey Epstein and the Professional Children's School (PCS) from 1997 to 2000.
The investigation sought records of tuition payments, third-party payments, donations, sponsored scholarships, or similar financial transactions related to Epstein.
Attorney Gary Stein of Schulte Roth & Zabel LLP was the point of contact for the prosecution regarding these records from PCS.
The email chain indicates an initial subpoena was issued, and a follow-up was needed to request additional records not covered by the initial subpoena.
